title: The Truth about Outliers Part One
question_text:
Which of the following statements about outliers is TRUE?
I. Outliers are easier to recognize in a histogram than in a stemplot.
II. When a distribution shows a possible outlier, the mean should be calculated two ways - with and without the outlier.
III. When a histogram shows a possible outlier, the bin width should be increased until the suspected value no longer looks like an outlier.
